channel.title: Violetta van Veen
channel.description: Recent content on Violetta van Veen

item.title: About
item.description: I am a master’s student in Public Policy and Development at Paris School of Economics. I graduated summa cum laude in July 2021 with a bachelor’s in Economics, Markets and Institutions at the University of Bologna, where I was a fellow at Collegio Superiore. My research interests lie primarily in the field of labor economics, in general as well as in particular from a gender perspective. This is a field I have been interested in since taking a course in Labor Economics during my bachelor’s as additional coursework beyond the requirements for my degree.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Academic Projects Replication study of Hatton (2016) Project for the Econometrics course at Tilburg University PDF Gender-based division of labor and fertility: from Becker (1960)’s theory to recent debates Bachelor’s final project PDF, Italian Gender equality in Italian honors colleges Paper for the Gender Equality and Social Inclusion at Collegio Superiore PDF, Italian On the Perception of Taxes Paper for the Public Economics course at University of Bologna PDF, Italian Articles The evolution of the internet between platform and infrastructure Published online by Istituto Treccani (first part, second part, Italian)
